articles.content:
Joint organization against U.S., war and nukes holds rally
    Pyongyang, November 30 (KCNA) -- The joint organization against the U.S., war and nukes grouping the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils, the south headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification, the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration and the headquarters of All-People Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Troops reportedly held a rally in Seoul on Nov 23 to implement the June 15 joint declaration and demand the conclusion of the DPRK-U.S. non-aggression treaty.
 A declaration read out at the rally said that a peaceful solution to the nuclear issue is to conclude a non-aggression treaty between North Korea and the U.S. and urged the latter to accept the proposal for concluding the treaty and get out of this land taking with it its nuclear weapons.    
 Prior to the rally, students distributed anti-U.S., anti-war and anti-nuke literature to citizens and held a photo exhibition on the killing of schoolgirls.

Greetings to Yasser Arafat
articles.content:
Greetings to Yasser Arafat
    Pyongyang, November 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Nov. 28 sent a message of greetings to Yasser Arafat, President of Palestine, Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) and Chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the World Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People.
 In the message Kim expressed firm solidarity with the president and people of Palestine in their just cause to restore the legitimate national right and achieve durable peace in the Middle East.    
 Saying that the Palestinian people are dynamically struggling to put an end to Israel's suffocation and occupation under the leadership of the PLO and achieve national independence and liberation, the message expressed belief that the ties of friendship and solidarity between the two peoples would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to Romanian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Romanian Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, November 30 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, Premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Adrian Nastase, Romanian Prime Minister, on the occasion of the National Day of Romania.
 The message wished him success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and the wellbeing of the people.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Mircea Dan Geoana, Romanian Foreign Minister on the same occasion.

articles.title: Greetings to Turkish Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Turkish Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, November 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Yasat Yakis upon his appointment as Foreign Minister of Turkey.
 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too, the message wished him success in the performance of his new duty.
